comment.author: 73199923@N00
comment._content:
"The King's Theatre, Marrickville, has been completed at a cost of £25,000. It introduces many now and exclusive features in theatre construction'. It has no windows or vents, being completely air-sealed. The air of the theatre is completely changed and purified every three minutes by a plant Installed by the Australian Gas Light Company, capable of circulating 30.000 cubic feet a minute. The winter temperature will be maintained at 70 degrees. There Is seating accommodation tor 1200-150 in the stalls and 450 in the dress circle. Tlie blendlng of the colour and lighting with the lines surfaces and pastel tones of KING'S THEATRE, MARRICKVILLE the auditorium is made more effective by the specially-concealed lighting system. Dimmer equipment gives special effects.

The King's, Marrickville, is the seventh suburban theatre of that name. The architect were Guy Crick and Bruce W. Purse and the builder J. Nyssen" (SMH May 1937)
